title: Can we get just ONE Rioter to address towers??
body:
Almost every fucking day I get on the boards and see "buff tower" posts. I feel like Riot is avoiding this issue.

I understand the boards make up a small % of the community, but all it takes it one thorough answer to calm some nerves. 

Just tell us WHY you want towers weak. It's not that hard.

replies.body:
Maple Nectar commented on them twice in the last month.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/M85EEWLB-does-riot-actually-listen-to-our-feedback?comment=000a00010002
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/PXqgGQss-riot-why-are-turrets-made-out-of-wet-toilet-paper?comment=000e

Oh hey thanks for posting these! I was going to come in and post the exact same links to Maple's posts re: slightly tankier towers. :)

----------------

EDIT: Good morning, Boards! 

I wrote this comment and then went to bed last night being like "hey I'll make an uncontroversial statement explaining how I was about to link to another Rioter's previous statements but then someone else helped me out and did that instead! Let's comment and thank them!" 

SURPRISE! IT IS APPARENTLY A VERY CONTROVERSIAL THANK YOU @ -45 PTS lmao 

Anyway so to update I spoke to Maple this morning and he mentioned the team is writing up a longer piece encompassing thoughts on towers, game pacing etc. as well.  I have no ETA on this piece, but it sounds like it will include more of the meaty design problems & decisions you guys are obviously looking for.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sparkle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rmqkXiog,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2017-12-04T06:38:27.496+0000)
>
> Oh hey thanks for posting these! I was going to come in and post the exact same links to Maple's posts re: slightly tankier towers. :)

You mean the pathetic +300HP turret buff that's been happening in this **current** patch? And also let's add in the ~~50%~~ 40% reduced minion damage as "compensation" cz why not....

And what are you exactly expecting to happen to turrets?
To be buffed to a point where it's the fountain laser protecting your ass and obliterating everything that looks at you funny? Turrets (as objectives) are meant to be taken down at some point and you will never see a state of League where you'd get 20 minutes to farm your ass off under the protection of your T1 turret. Whether or not it's still standing at that point in time is up to you.

Simply expecting Riot to buff towers in a way that when you die (usually by ganks) in mid-top (and specially bot) you don't instantly lose your tower around 7-8 minutes (sometimes 5), destroying your whole game because of a single mistake - Also, avoiding the "games are decided at the 10 minutes mark" and who knows ... allowing towers to actually deal damage? Because I am starting to see that the 66,66% damage reduction (without nearby minions) is not really useful if the tower cannot provide any damage in exchange.

Buffing turrets to be more dangerous and not more durable seems like a logical step to me. I don't need a second base at every tier defense on every lane or we'll run into a problem of having to have your entire team on a single lane to be able to push something. And i don't want 30 minute farmfests where literally nothing is happening because kills mean nothing and turrets take no damage from your pathetic looking stats unless you're 4+ items down the line.
League of legends had towers that dealt damage and was hard to bring it down for almost 5 years, and never was a 30 min farmfest.
Yeah the +10% minion dmg is more of a nerf to turrets than the distraction of +2 {{item:1028}}

Thanks for the edit. I know you guys get dumpstered a lot but I think it's because many of us don't know how to handle our passion in a non cancerous way.

The fact you guys are gonna talk about game pace is a huge relief because it's been my biggest concern for a long time. I wish I saw it sooner but the game being so fast causes a lot of problems because of the need to speed up damage gain and such. I love Ashe, but games end before I can scale at all because she falls into a niche position of less damage for utility, but the current state of the game punishes non damage picks.

I don't know, I'm just glad you guys are gonna talk about it and sorry for the amount of punching bag you cosplay as.

Oh no worries dude! I'm actually pretty pumped that my first truly dumpstered comment is just me thanking a dude instead of me royally screwing something up. Cuz I always worry that somehow by speaking publicly to you all I'll royally screw something up haha 

Also now I'm imagining what it would look like if I actually cosplayed a punching bag IRL. ;)
I Upvoted it for ya now in exchange fix those mordekaiser bugs *Wink Wink Nudge Nudge*   {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sparkle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rmqkXiog,comment-id=00020001000e0000,timestamp=2017-12-04T19:03:47.809+0000)

My first dumpstered comment was me making a joke about how there was technically more than one AP Armor item because Seeker's Armguard, Zeke's Herald, and Wooglet's Witchcap existed. It still haunts me to this day...

I totally get the fear of speaking publically as a Rioter. I realize the immense pressure on you to say stuff that doesn't give players a false image or makes Riot look bad, because if someone makes a bad comment (like Riot Sanjuro) then that person's comment can be seen very easily and then quoted, and then people will just reference that comment until the end of time (like Riot Silver's comment about Graves's cigar). It's a scary thought! I appreciate you and Maple Nectar's willingness to comment frequently on the Boards, more communication with Riot is always something the players appreciate, even if the appreciation is shrouded by a mask of anger and displeasure. We just want someone to talk to because Rioters are pretty cool. :)

I feel bad that you got dumpstered because you made an innocent comment. I think it makes Rioters not want to interact with the Boards if all it takes is an innocent comment to get downvoted!

The problem is that the +300 HP didn't do anything. In fact the bonus minion damage VS towers is outweighing the 300 HP significantly and towers are actually squishier now.

Towers need serious buffs, not these jokes. They need to have about 30-50% more HP, they need to have 15% bonus damage to champs scaling up to 25% as they ramp or some other similar changes to these. Towers need drastic buffs because right now they're utterly pathetic, even more so on 7.23 than 7.22.

I think that all towers need to have their "top/mid lane" buffs til at least 10 minutes into the game. they also need to be smarter and due true damage starting about the 15/20 minute mark. they should be feared, not be the laughing joke that a garen with a cloth armor can tank to his hearts content while wailing away at the tower.. especially when he's regenning more than what the tower is dishing out.
It's just like riot tries to give us a big summer sale with that turret "buffs" by hoping to not read the fine print. Rofl

I think they mean comment on how that change affected Towers. The intention was to make them slightly tankier but it might not have hit the mark. We were wondering if there will be any follow-up, if you're satisfied with the change, if you have any data you would like to share with us, etc. 

Thanks for wanting to share the other links for people who haven't noticed the changes anyways.

See, I do believe that a lot of folks actually want the info you're referencing here but that actually wasn't the question asked unfortunately. :c The question asked was this: 

>Just tell us WHY you want towers weak. It's not that hard.

Like, that just starts with a false assumption. Even if I felt qualified to talk deeply on this subject, which I don't (hence referring to someone else's words), I can't answer that question because the question itself is just simply...not true. 

Anyway to answer YOUR question, I can't speak to the follow up or satisfaction of the change because I am not working on the project, but Maple has told me the team is writing up a longer form thing to talk about towers, game pacing, etc. that will probably touch on a lot of what you're asking for here. I have no ETA on when that will happen, but it's in the works. :)

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sparkle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rmqkXiog,comment-id=0002000100090000,timestamp=2017-12-04T18:17:01.412+0000)
>
but Maple has told me

Not that it's any of my business, but shouldn't MAPLE be the one responding to this then? I appreciate the time and effort, but does Maple not have a quick minute to discuss the balance state of towers if it's such a hot topic?

EDIT: That wasn't a sarcastic retort. It was a legitimate question. It just seemed odd the person having next to nothing to do with it would be the one responding to the thread.

That's a totally fair question. From my perspective, I wouldn't wanna pull anyone off of what they're working on to answer to an inquisition that I basically accidentally started. Especially if the thing they're working on is basically just...more well articulated thoughts about this stuff. Like yeah, finish that up instead IMO. That being said, I'm happy to stick around. :) 

Plus, given the team is writing their own longer form thingy I figure it's probably better to have the actual design conversation take place wherever they post that as opposed to splitting everyone's attention into a buncha places. In my personal experience, having one place that players can go to in order to talk about a thing or look at to find all the relevant answers works best for making sure the maximum amount of players can find what they're looking for. That's not a hard and fast rule, but when it's something a lot of players have been talking about I think the visibility is important.

EDIT: Hey friends, please don't downvote EkyonKun. It is actually a good question!

I really don't want to be rude, because I'm grateful for your answer despite us, the boards, being so hostile towards Rioters most of the time, but I just wanted to let you know how I feel at the moment: After Varus' lore fiasco and seasons of silence on towers and 'everything creep' and the last set of changes to towers, I, and lot of other players probably, won't be expecting much from such a write-up. 

I fear it'll just say something like ... you hear our worries, you'll talk a bit about game pacing and strategy and keeping things fresh and exciting, you might talk a little bit about what the +300 Health did and give some vague, general statements about what Riot wants from League in the future and how you want to satisfy the players, and that will be it. Nothing will actually be changed. 

I think we might want some token gesture to reestablish faith? Not that you can truly do that. The boards will probably always be hostile. But just *something*. Maybe just give towers another +300 Health and see what happens. Or add an alternative Varus lore page to the League website that fleshes out his family and says that Pallas is a morally ambiguous Darkin. Or increase the price of all items by 100 gold.
Would game pacing include how quickly champions are scaling? Because I've been waiting a while for somebody from Riot to talk about Marksmen scaling

>I can't answer that question because the question itself is just simply...not true.

Is what you say, but a majority of decisions for the past while prove that claim to be false.

Yet I can still get on my tanky top laner or ADC, and milk a tower below 50% before my opponent gets back to their lane. If I have even one damage dealing team mate with me, you can kiss that tower goodbye. I knew the towers were buffed, but it hardly made a difference in game besides slow the pace just a tad bit.
The community asked for the tower to deal more damage to opponents so that tower diving  is frowned upon as it once was before. 
If Rioters could please, just test an increase in tower damage in PBE, I'm sure the community would be happy to give you a response.
Actually the pace is not slowed. According to stat sites the average game time is even shorter now
Probably because of the minions buff, classic riot.

I got a couple questions/suggestions


1.Why {{champion:28}} level 1 ult CD 140s when the norm tends to be 120~110? I dont think its a strong enough skill to warrant such a high CD...

2.Wud it be cool if {{champion:254}} got a some changes specifically  so she feels better about {{item:3053}}  Like making denting blows total AD instead of Bonus??

You should copy and paste this into an actual board.
Ahri's passive is fine. It used to be like Morgana's where she got Spellvamp at 9 stacks, but was changed to flat healing per hit that scales at level increments.

Ahri's innate passive should have been what was added to her Q. That little bonus Movespeed on spellcast thing would be the perfect replacement considering Ahri's big strength is supposed to be her mobility/kiting.

Ahris current Essence thief passive is like really strong in lane esp with {{item:3802}}   but a complete non factor OUT of lane.

Essence Thief, while helpful in lane, isn't "really strong". It's definitely noticeable if used well, though. However it is _not_ a non-factor outside of lane. It allows her to make plays without having to back immediately after. If she makes a pick bot, she can just heal up off of the wave and continue to push and pressure much more safely because she didn't have to back. It's just not particularly useful in combat if you're not keenly aware of it.

Debatable.

By the time you've found either a sizable minion wave, set up the passive, actually used it to heal enough (which may need to be used more than once), I probably could have recalled and returned to lane twice.
None of that is necessary. You can just naturally push a wave, and as long as you get a good Q when the passive comes up, you're good. It's not like you need to set up a 14 minion wave.
you make it sound like Qing a wave will take you from near-death to full

Would you like to comment on how game times have seemed to drop after that 'buff'?

That was my main problem. Been playing since S3 and surrenders are rampant. Right now, either damage is too high or people snowball waay to fast compared to previous seasons. Whether or not that is because of weak towers is something I wanted Riot to address. Honestly, I don't think Riot really anticipated the impact of first tower gold.

I mean, those comments were: "Guys, be patient! There's some changes to turrets in 7.23!" and "Guys don't worry, the changes we're pushing in 7.23 will make towers tankier!"

That's not really comforting, nor does it inform us of Riot's vision of how turrets should be.
7.23 is the live patch. The changes they are talking about were the +300 HP and minions deal increased damage to towers which actually resulted in squishier towers overall.
Squisher Towers only by minion damage becoming the majority damage against a Tower. Otherwise, it still takes longer if the majority of damage to a tower is a champion.

The problem is that the way you typically play around T1 towers makes minion damage the significant majority. Typically these towers fall early, which means champ damage is low relative to creep damage, often champions will allow minions to die to the tower to deny them while farming the enemy minions and early damage often comes from creeps pushing into the tower.

I don't think it's that rare for more than 3000 raw creep damage (1800 post mitigation on 7.23), which is the number needed for the 10% boost to creep damage to balance out the 300 extra HP.

Something else to think about is that outer towers have 3800 HP since 7.23. This means creeps don't need to do a majority of the towers HP for it to fall faster, if they deal half, distinctly not a majority then they've dealt 317 extra damage, outweighing the 300 extra HP already. 

Simple math shows that in a realistic situation tower bulk has gone down. The only time when this isn't the case is VS a 3+ man push, but in these cases dealing 300 extra damage isn't even a challenge. The towers last an extra 2 seconds VS 3 people, big fucking deal. The fact that they die quicker to creeps is a far larger impact than that.
Right, they seem to have misunderstood what the changes would do. But more than that, the responses weren't helpful at illustrating their design philosophy for towers.

It's become increasingly clear that their philosophy is to keep towers as weak as possible, even going as far as to nerf already pathetic towers while calling it a buff. It's a clearly destructive philosophy and the only people who are blind to that are Riot themselves.
You mean +300 hp? sure

You aren't going to get anything from them but the same bs of how they don't think they are actually that bad (they think they are fine and we are overreacting somehow), and that they actually think this latest change IS a buff to towers (which it is only if you do the Riot thing and look at changes in a vacuum and ignore the minion changes).

It's pointless to even ask for Riot responses anymore I've learned.

They see the game from a very odd perspective I've grown to learn, and I've given up believing they will understand it from the perspective of the players on the whole.
